intro: Plagiogyria adnata, commonly known as the common plagiogyria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Plagiogyria adnata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
